extruder_nr.label: Extruder
extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing. This is used in multi-extrusion.

machine_nozzle_offset_x.label: Nozzle X Offset
machine_nozzle_offset_x.description: The x-coordinate of the offset of the nozzle.

machine_nozzle_offset_y.label: Nozzle Y Offset
machine_nozzle_offset_y.description: The y-coordinate of the offset of the nozzle.

machine_extruder_start_code.label: Extruder Start G-Code
machine_extruder_start_code.description: Start g-code to execute when switching to this extruder.

machine_extruder_start_pos_abs.label: Extruder Start Position Absolute
machine_extruder_start_pos_abs.description: Make the extruder starting position absolute rather than relative to the last-known location of the head.

machine_extruder_start_pos_x.label: Extruder Start Position X
machine_extruder_start_pos_x.description: The x-coordinate of the starting position when turning the extruder on.

machine_extruder_start_pos_y.label: Extruder Start Position Y
machine_extruder_start_pos_y.description: The y-coordinate of the starting position when turning the extruder on.

machine_extruder_end_code.label: Extruder End G-Code
machine_extruder_end_code.description: End g-code to execute when switching away from this extruder.

machine_extruder_end_pos_abs.label: Extruder End Position Absolute
machine_extruder_end_pos_abs.description: Make the extruder ending position absolute rather than relative to the last-known location of the head.

machine_extruder_end_pos_x.label: Extruder End Position X
machine_extruder_end_pos_x.description: The x-coordinate of the ending position when turning the extruder off.

machine_extruder_end_pos_y.label: Extruder End Position Y
machine_extruder_end_pos_y.description: The y-coordinate of the ending position when turning the extruder off.

machine_extruder_cooling_fan_number.label: Extruder Print Cooling Fan
machine_extruder_cooling_fan_number.description: The number of the print cooling fan associated with this extruder. Only change this from the default value of 0 when you have a different print cooling fan for each extruder.

machine_name.label: Machine Type
machine_name.description: The name of your 3D printer model.

machine_show_variants.label: Show Machine Variants
machine_show_variants.description: Whether to show the different variants of this machine, which are described in separate json files.

machine_start_gcode.label: Start G-code
machine_start_gcode.description: G-code commands to be executed at the very start - separated by \n.
machine_start_gcode.default_value:
M220 S100 ;Reset Feedrate
M221 S100 ;Reset Flowrate

G28 ;Home

G92 E0 ;Reset Extruder
G1 Z2.0 F3000 ;Move Z Axis up
G1 X10.1 Y20 Z0.28 F5000.0 ;Move to start position
G1 X10.1 Y145.0 Z0.28 F1500.0 E15 ;Draw the first line
G1 X10.4 Y145.0 Z0.28 F5000.0 ;Move to side a little
G1 X10.4 Y20 Z0.28 F1500.0 E30 ;Draw the second line
G92 E0  ;Reset Extruder
G1 E-1.0000 F1800 ;Retract a bit
G1 Z2.0 F3000 ;Move Z Axis up
G1 E0.0000 F1800

machine_end_gcode.label: End G-code
machine_end_gcode.description: G-code commands to be executed at the very end - separated by \n.
machine_end_gcode.default_value:
G91 ;Relative positionning
G1 E-2 F2700 ;Retract a bit
G1 E-2 Z0.2 F2400 ;Retract and raise Z
G1 X5 Y5 F3000 ;Wipe out
G1 Z10 ;Raise Z more
G90 ;Absolute positionning

G1 X0 Y0 ;Present print
M106 S0 ;Turn-off fan
M104 S0 ;Turn-off hotend
M140 S0 ;Turn-off bed

M84 X Y E ;Disable all steppers but Z

material_guid.label: Material GUID
material_guid.description: GUID of the material. This is set automatically.

material_diameter.label: Diameter
material_diameter.description: Adjusts the diameter of the filament used. Match this value with the diameter of the used filament.

material_bed_temp_wait.label: Wait for Build Plate Heatup
material_bed_temp_wait.description: Whether to insert a command to wait until the build plate temperature is reached at the start.

material_print_temp_wait.label: Wait for Nozzle Heatup
material_print_temp_wait.description: Whether to wait until the nozzle temperature is reached at the start.

bed_print_temp_wait_sync.label: Wait for Nozzle Heatup And Bed Headup Sync
bed_print_temp_wait_sync.description: Whether to wait until the nozzle temperature and bed temperature sync.

material_print_temp_prepend.label: Include Material Temperatures
material_print_temp_prepend.description: Whether to include nozzle temperature commands at the start of the gcode. When the start_gcode already contains nozzle temperature commands Creality Print frontend will automatically disable this setting.

material_bed_temp_prepend.label: Include Build Plate Temperature
material_bed_temp_prepend.description: Whether to include build plate temperature commands at the start of the gcode. When the start_gcode already contains build plate temperature commands Creality Print frontend will automatically disable this setting.

machine_width.label: Machine Width
machine_width.description: The width (X-direction) of the printable area.

machine_depth.label: Machine Depth
machine_depth.description: The depth (Y-direction) of the printable area.

machine_shape.label: Build Plate Shape
machine_shape.description: The shape of the build plate without taking unprintable areas into account.

machine_buildplate_type.label: Build Plate Material
machine_buildplate_type.description: The material of the build plate installed on the printer.

machine_height.label: Machine Height
machine_height.description: The height (Z-direction) of the printable area.

machine_heated_bed.label: Has Heated Build Plate
machine_heated_bed.description: Whether the machine has a heated build plate present.

machine_heated_build_volume.label: Has Build Volume Temperature Stabilization
machine_heated_build_volume.description: Whether the machine is able to stabilize the build volume temperature.

machine_center_is_zero.label: Is Center Origin
machine_center_is_zero.description: Whether the X/Y coordinates of the zero position of the printer is at the center of the printable area.

machine_extruder_count.label: Number of Extruders
machine_extruder_count.description: Number of extruder trains. An extruder train is the combination of a feeder, bowden tube, and nozzle.

machine_extruder_type.label: Extruder Type
machine_extruder_type.description: Whether the extruder of machine is distal.

extruders_enabled_count.label: Number of Extruders That Are Enabled
extruders_enabled_count.description: Number of extruder trains that are enabled; automatically set in software

machine_nozzle_tip_outer_diameter.label: Outer Nozzle Diameter
machine_nozzle_tip_outer_diameter.description: The outer diameter of the tip of the nozzle.

machine_nozzle_head_distance.label: Nozzle Length
machine_nozzle_head_distance.description: The height difference between the tip of the nozzle and the lowest part of the print head.

machine_nozzle_expansion_angle.label: Nozzle Angle
machine_nozzle_expansion_angle.description: The angle between the horizontal plane and the conical part right above the tip of the nozzle.

machine_heat_zone_length.label: Heat Zone Length
machine_heat_zone_length.description: The distance from the tip of the nozzle in which heat from the nozzle is transferred to the filament.

machine_filament_park_distance.label: Filament Park Distance
machine_filament_park_distance.description: The distance from the tip of the nozzle where to park the filament when an extruder is no longer used.

machine_nozzle_temp_enabled.label: Enable Nozzle Temperature Control
machine_nozzle_temp_enabled.description: Whether to control temperature from Creality Print. Turn this off to control nozzle temperature from outside of Creality Print.

machine_nozzle_heat_up_speed.label: Heat Up Speed
machine_nozzle_heat_up_speed.description: The speed (°C/s) by which the nozzle heats up averaged over the window of normal printing temperatures and the standby temperature.

machine_nozzle_cool_down_speed.label: Cool Down Speed
machine_nozzle_cool_down_speed.description: The speed (°C/s) by which the nozzle cools down averaged over the window of normal printing temperatures and the standby temperature.

machine_min_cool_heat_time_window.label: Minimal Time Standby Temperature
machine_min_cool_heat_time_window.description: The minimal time an extruder has to be inactive before the nozzle is cooled. Only when an extruder is not used for longer than this time will it be allowed to cool down to the standby temperature.

machine_fan_speed_up_time.label: Regular Fan Speed Up Time
machine_fan_speed_up_time.description: Advance the fan start command by the specified time to compensate for the fan speed up time.

machine_cds_fan_speed_up_time.label: Regular Cds Fan Speed Up Time
machine_cds_fan_speed_up_time.description: Advance the fan start command by the specified time to compensate for the cds fan speed up time.

machine_chamber_fan_exist.label: Chamber Fan Exist
machine_chamber_fan_exist.description: Whether Chamber Fan Exist in the machine.

machine_cds_fan_exist.label: Cds Fan Exist
machine_cds_fan_exist.description: Whether Cds Fan Exist in the machine.

machine_platform_motion_enable.label: platform Y-axis fix
machine_platform_motion_enable.description: Whether to fix the printing platform in the Y-axis direction.

machine_LED_light_exist.label: LED Light Exist
machine_LED_light_exist.description: Whether LED Light Exist in the machine.

machine_gcode_flavor.label: G-code Flavor
machine_gcode_flavor.description: The type of g-code to be generated.

machine_firmware_retract.label: Firmware Retraction
machine_firmware_retract.description: Whether to use firmware retract commands (G10/G11) instead of using the E property in G1 commands to retract the material.

machine_extruders_share_heater.label: Extruders Share Heater
machine_extruders_share_heater.description: Whether the extruders share a single heater rather than each extruder having its own heater.

machine_disallowed_areas.label: Disallowed Areas
machine_disallowed_areas.description: A list of polygons with areas the print head is not allowed to enter.

nozzle_disallowed_areas.label: Nozzle Disallowed Areas
nozzle_disallowed_areas.description: A list of polygons with areas the nozzle is not allowed to enter.

machine_head_with_fans_polygon.label: Machine Head & Fan Polygon
machine_head_with_fans_polygon.description: A 2D silhouette of the print head (fan caps included).

gantry_height.label: Gantry Height
gantry_height.description: The height difference between the tip of the nozzle and the gantry system (X and Y axes).

machine_nozzle_id.label: Nozzle ID
machine_nozzle_id.description: The nozzle ID for an extruder train, such as "AA 0.4" and "BB 0.8".

machine_nozzle_size.label: Nozzle Diameter
machine_nozzle_size.description: The inner diameter of the nozzle. Change this setting when using a non-standard nozzle size.

machine_use_extruder_offset_to_offset_co.label: Offset with Extruder
machine_use_extruder_offset_to_offset_co.description: Apply the extruder offset to the coordinate system.

extruder_prime_pos_z.label: Extruder Prime Z Position
extruder_prime_pos_z.description: The Z coordinate of the position where the nozzle primes at the start of printing.

extruder_prime_pos_abs.label: Absolute Extruder Prime Position
extruder_prime_pos_abs.description: Make the extruder prime position absolute rather than relative to the last-known location of the head.

machine_max_feedrate_x.label: Maximum Speed X
machine_max_feedrate_x.description: The maximum speed for the motor of the X-direction.

machine_max_feedrate_y.label: Maximum Speed Y
machine_max_feedrate_y.description: The maximum speed for the motor of the Y-direction.

machine_max_feedrate_z.label: Maximum Speed Z
machine_max_feedrate_z.description: The maximum speed for the motor of the Z-direction.

machine_max_feedrate_e.label: Maximum Feedrate
machine_max_feedrate_e.description: The maximum speed of the filament.

machine_max_acceleration_x.label: Maximum Acceleration X
machine_max_acceleration_x.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the X-direction

machine_max_acceleration_y.label: Maximum Acceleration Y
machine_max_acceleration_y.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the Y-direction.

machine_max_acceleration_z.label: Maximum Acceleration Z
machine_max_acceleration_z.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the Z-direction.

machine_max_acceleration_e.label: Maximum Filament Acceleration
machine_max_acceleration_e.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the filament.

machine_acceleration.label: Default Acceleration
machine_acceleration.description: The default acceleration of print head movement.

machine_max_jerk_xy.label: Default X-Y Jerk
machine_max_jerk_xy.description: Default jerk for movement in the horizontal plane.

machine_max_jerk_z.label: Default Z Jerk
machine_max_jerk_z.description: Default jerk for the motor of the Z-direction.

machine_max_jerk_e.label: Default Filament Jerk
machine_max_jerk_e.description: Default jerk for the motor of the filament.

machine_steps_per_mm_x.label: Steps per Millimeter (X)
machine_steps_per_mm_x.description: How many steps of the stepper motor will result in one millimeter of movement in the X direction.

machine_steps_per_mm_y.label: Steps per Millimeter (Y)
machine_steps_per_mm_y.description: How many steps of the stepper motor will result in one millimeter of movement in the Y direction.

machine_steps_per_mm_z.label: Steps per Millimeter (Z)
machine_steps_per_mm_z.description: How many steps of the stepper motor will result in one millimeter of movement in the Z direction.

machine_steps_per_mm_e.label: Steps per Millimeter (E)
machine_steps_per_mm_e.description: How many steps of the stepper motors will result in one millimeter of extrusion.

machine_endstop_positive_direction_x.label: X Endstop in Positive Direction
machine_endstop_positive_direction_x.description: Whether the endstop of the X axis is in the positive direction (high X coordinate) or negative (low X coordinate).

machine_endstop_positive_direction_y.label: Y Endstop in Positive Direction
machine_endstop_positive_direction_y.description: Whether the endstop of the Y axis is in the positive direction (high Y coordinate) or negative (low Y coordinate).

machine_endstop_positive_direction_z.label: Z Endstop in Positive Direction
machine_endstop_positive_direction_z.description: Whether the endstop of the Z axis is in the positive direction (high Z coordinate) or negative (low Z coordinate).

machine_minimum_feedrate.label: Minimum Feedrate
machine_minimum_feedrate.description: The minimal movement speed of the print head.

machine_feeder_wheel_diameter.label: Feeder Wheel Diameter
machine_feeder_wheel_diameter.description: The diameter of the wheel that drives the material in the feeder.

machine_belt_offset_Y.label: Belt Offset Y
machine_belt_offset_Y.description: Compensation value of model lift height.

machine_is_belt.label: belt machine
machine_is_belt.description: Whether the machine structure is belt.

machine_always_write_active_tool.label: Always Write Active Tool
machine_always_write_active_tool.description: Write active tool after sending temp commands to inactive tool. Required for Dual Extruder printing with Smoothie or other firmware with modal tool commands.

machine_extruders_share_nozzle.label: Extruders Share Nozzle
machine_extruders_share_nozzle.description: Whether the extruders share a single nozzle rather than each extruder having its own nozzle. When set to true, it is expected that the printer-start gcode script properly sets up all extruders in an initial retraction state that is known and mutually compatible (either zero or one filament not retracted); in that case the initial retraction status is described, per extruder, by the 'machine_extruders_shared_nozzle_initial_retraction' parameter.

machine_extruders_shared_nozzle_initial_.label: Shared Nozzle Initial Retraction
machine_extruders_shared_nozzle_initial_.description: How much the filament of each extruder is assumed to have been retracted from the shared nozzle tip at the completion of the printer-start gcode script; the value should be equal to or greater than the length of the common part of the nozzle's ducts.

machine_scale_fan_speed_zero_to_one.label: Scale Fan Speed To 0-1
machine_scale_fan_speed_zero_to_one.description: Scale the fan speed to be between 0 and 1 instead of between 0 and 256.

resolution.label: Quality
resolution.description: All settings that influence the resolution of the print. These settings have a large impact on the quality (and print time)

layer_height.label: Layer Height
layer_height.description: The height of each layer in mm. Higher values produce faster prints in lower resolution, lower values produce slower prints in higher resolution.

layer_height_0.label: Initial Layer Height
layer_height_0.description: The height of the initial layer in mm. A thicker initial layer makes adhesion of the build plate easier.

small_hole_max_size.label: Small Hole Max Size
small_hole_max_size.description: Holes and part outlines with a diameter smaller than this will be printed using Small Feature Speed.

small_feature_max_length.label: Small Feature Max Length
small_feature_max_length.description: Feature outlines that are shorter than this length will be printed using Small Feature Speed.

small_feature_speed_factor.label: Small Feature Speed
small_feature_speed_factor.description: Small features will be printed at this percentage of their normal print speed. Slower printing can help with adhesion and accuracy.

small_feature_speed_factor_0.label: Small Feature Initial Layer Speed
small_feature_speed_factor_0.description: Small features on the first layer will be printed at this percentage of their normal print speed. Slower printing can help with adhesion and accuracy.

bridge_settings_enabled.label: Enable Bridge Settings
bridge_settings_enabled.description: Detect bridges and modify print speed, flow and fan settings while bridges are printed.

bridge_wall_min_length.label: Minimum Bridge Wall Length
bridge_wall_min_length.description: Unsupported walls shorter than this will be printed using the normal wall settings. Longer unsupported walls will be printed using the bridge wall settings.

bridge_skin_support_threshold.label: Bridge Skin Support Threshold
bridge_skin_support_threshold.description: If a skin region is supported for less than this percentage of its area, print it using the bridge settings. Otherwise it is printed using the normal skin settings.

bridge_sparse_infill_max_density.label: Bridge Sparse Infill Max Density
bridge_sparse_infill_max_density.description: Maximum density of infill considered to be sparse. Skin over sparse infill is considered to be unsupported and therefore may be treated as a bridge skin.

bridge_wall_coast.label: Bridge Wall Coasting
bridge_wall_coast.description: This controls the distance the extruder should coast immediately before a bridge wall begins. Coasting before the bridge starts can reduce the pressure in the nozzle and may produce a flatter bridge.

bridge_wall_speed.label: Bridge Wall Speed
bridge_wall_speed.description: The speed at which the bridge walls are printed.

bridge_wall_material_flow.label: Bridge Wall Flow
bridge_wall_material_flow.description: When printing bridge walls, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

bridge_skin_speed.label: Bridge Skin Speed
bridge_skin_speed.description: The speed at which bridge skin regions are printed.

bridge_skin_material_flow.label: Bridge Skin Flow
bridge_skin_material_flow.description: When printing bridge skin regions, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

bridge_skin_density.label: Bridge Skin Density
bridge_skin_density.description: The density of the bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

bridge_enable_more_layers.label: Bridge Has Multiple Layers
bridge_enable_more_layers.description: If enabled, the second and third layers above the air are printed using the following settings. Otherwise, those layers are printed using the normal settings.

bridge_skin_speed_2.label: Bridge Second Skin Speed
bridge_skin_speed_2.description: Print speed to use when printing the second bridge skin layer.

bridge_skin_material_flow_2.label: Bridge Second Skin Flow
bridge_skin_material_flow_2.description: When printing the second bridge skin layer, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

bridge_skin_density_2.label: Bridge Second Skin Density
bridge_skin_density_2.description: The density of the second bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

bridge_skin_speed_3.label: Bridge Third Skin Speed
bridge_skin_speed_3.description: Print speed to use when printing the third bridge skin layer.

bridge_skin_material_flow_3.label: Bridge Third Skin Flow
bridge_skin_material_flow_3.description: When printing the third bridge skin layer, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

bridge_skin_density_3.label: Bridge Third Skin Density
bridge_skin_density_3.description: The density of the third bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

wall_extruder_nr.label: Wall Extruder
wall_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the walls. This is used in multi-extrusion.

wall_0_extruder_nr.label: Outer Wall Extruder
wall_0_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the outer wall. This is used in multi-extrusion.

wall_x_extruder_nr.label: Inner Wall Extruder
wall_x_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the inner walls. This is used in multi-extrusion.

wall_thickness.label: Wall Thickness
wall_thickness.description: The thickness of the walls in the horizontal direction. This value divided by the wall line width defines the number of walls.

wall_line_count.label: Wall Line Count
wall_line_count.description: The number of walls. When calculated by the wall thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

wall_transition_length.label: Wall Transition Length
wall_transition_length.description: When transitioning between different numbers of walls as the part becomes thinner, a certain amount of space is allotted to split or join the wall lines.

wall_distribution_count.label: Wall Distribution Count
wall_distribution_count.description: The number of walls, counted from the center, over which the variation needs to be spread. Lower values mean that the outer walls don't change in width.

wall_transition_angle.label: Wall Transitioning Threshold Angle
wall_transition_angle.description: When to create transitions between even and odd numbers of walls. A wedge shape with an angle greater than this setting will not have transitions and no walls will be printed in the center to fill the remaining space. Reducing this setting reduces the number and length of these center walls, but may leave gaps or overextrude.

wall_transition_filter_distance.label: Wall Transitioning Filter Distance
wall_transition_filter_distance.description: If it would be transitioning back and forth between different numbers of walls in quick succession, don't transition at all. Remove transitions if they are closer together than this distance.

wall_transition_filter_deviation.label: Wall Transitioning Filter Margin
wall_transition_filter_deviation.description: Prevent transitioning back and forth between one extra wall and one less. This margin extends the range of line widths which follow to [Minimum Wall Line Width - Margin, 2 * Minimum Wall Line Width + Margin]. Increasing this margin reduces the number of transitions, which reduces the number of extrusion starts/stops and travel time. However, large line width variation can lead to under- or overextrusion problems.

roofing_only_one_wall.label: Only One Wall for Roofing
roofing_only_one_wall.description: Only a single wall is used for the top surface, so that more space can be used for the roofing pattern.

roofing_extruder_nr.label: Top Surface Skin Extruder
roofing_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the top most skin. This is used in multi-extrusion.

top_bottom_extruder_nr.label: Top/Bottom Extruder
top_bottom_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the top and bottom skin. This is used in multi-extrusion.

top_bottom_thickness.label: Top/Bottom Thickness
top_bottom_thickness.description: The thickness of the top/bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top/bottom layers.

top_thickness.label: Top Thickness
top_thickness.description: The thickness of the top layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top layers.

top_layers.label: Top Layers
top_layers.description: The number of top layers. When calculated by the top thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

bottom_thickness.label: Bottom Thickness
bottom_thickness.description: The thickness of the bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of bottom layers.

bottom_layers.label: Bottom Layers
bottom_layers.description: The number of bottom layers. When calculated by the bottom thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

initial_bottom_layers.label: Initial Bottom Layers
initial_bottom_layers.description: The number of initial bottom layers, from the build-plate upwards. When calculated by the bottom thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

roofing_layer_count.label: Top Surface Skin Layers
roofing_layer_count.description: The number of top most skin layers. Usually only one top most layer is sufficient to generate higher quality top surfaces.

top_bottom_pattern.label: Top/Bottom Pattern
top_bottom_pattern.description: The pattern of the top/bottom layers.

top_bottom_pattern_0.label: Bottom Pattern Initial Layer
top_bottom_pattern_0.description: The pattern on the first layer at the bottom of the print.

roofing_pattern.label: Top Surface Skin Pattern
roofing_pattern.description: The pattern of the top most layers.

connect_skin_polygons.label: Connect Top/Bottom Polygons
connect_skin_polygons.description: Connect top/bottom skin paths where they run next to each other. For the concentric pattern enabling this setting greatly reduces the travel time, but since the connections can happen midway over fillinh, this feature can reduce the top surface quality.

skin_monotonic.label: Monotonic Top/Bottom Order
skin_monotonic.description: Print top/bottom lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.

roofing_monotonic.label: Monotonic Top Surface Order
roofing_monotonic.description: Print top surface lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.

skin_angles.label: Top/Bottom Line Directions
skin_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use when the top/bottom layers use the lines or zig zag pattern. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees).

roofing_angles.label: Top Surface Skin Line Directions
roofing_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use when the top surface skin layers use the lines or zig zag pattern. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees).

wall_0_inset.label: Outer Wall Inset
wall_0_inset.description: Inset applied to the path of the outer wall. If the outer wall is smaller than the nozzle, and printed after the inner walls, use this offset to get the hole in the nozzle to overlap with the inner walls instead of the outside of the model.

optimize_wall_printing_order.label: Optimize Wall Printing Order
optimize_wall_printing_order.description: Optimize the order of wall printing to reduce the number of retracements and the distance travelled. Most parts will benefit from enabling this feature, but some may take longer, so compare the estimated printing time with not optimized. The first layer was not optimized when selecting the brim as build plate adhesion type.

inset_direction.label: Wall Ordering
inset_direction.description: Determines the order in which walls are printed. Printing outer walls earlier helps with dimensional accuracy, as faults from inner walls cannot propagate to the outside. However printing them later allows them to stack better when overhangs are printed. When there is an uneven amount of total innner walls, the 'center last line' is always printed last.

wall_ordering_overhang_angle.label: Overhang wall Angle when using flexible printing sequence
wall_ordering_overhang_angle.description: Walls that overhang beyond this Angle will use the printing sequence of inner wall first then outer wall, otherwise use outer wall first then inner wall.

outer_inset_first.label: Outer Wall First, Inner Wall Second
outer_inset_first.description: Prints walls in order of outside to inside when enabled. This can help improve the dimensional accuracy of X and Y when using a high viscosity plastic like ABS; however it may reduce outer surface print quality, especially on overhangs.

alternate_extra_perimeter.label: Alternate Extra Wall
alternate_extra_perimeter.description: Print an extra wall every other layer. In this way, the filler will get stuck between these extra walls, resulting in stronger print quality.

unify_walls_print_direction.label: Unify Walls Print Drection
unify_walls_print_direction.description: the walls of the outside shape and the holes will be printed in the same direction.

min_wall_line_width.label: Minimum Wall Line Width
min_wall_line_width.description: For thin structures around once or twice the nozzle size, the line widths need to be altered to adhere to the thickness of the model. This setting controls the minimum line width allowed for the walls. The minimum line widths inherently also determine the maximum line widths, since we transition from N to N+1 walls at some geometry thickness where the N walls are wide and the N+1 walls are narrow. The widest possible wall line is twice the Minimum Wall Line Width.

min_even_wall_line_width.label: Minimum Even Wall Line Width
min_even_wall_line_width.description: The minimum line width for normal polygonal walls. This setting determines at which model thickness we switch from printing a single thin wall line, to printing two wall lines. A higher Minimum Even Wall Line Width leads to a higher maximum odd wall line width. The maximum even wall line width is calculated as Outer Wall Line Width + 0.5 * Minimum Odd Wall Line Width.

min_odd_wall_line_width.label: Minimum Odd Wall Line Width
min_odd_wall_line_width.description: The minimum line width for middle line gap filler polyline walls. This setting determines at which model thickness we switch from printing two wall lines, to printing two outer walls and a single central wall in the middle. A higher Minimum Odd Wall Line Width leads to a higher maximum even wall line width. The maximum odd wall line width is calculated as 2 * Minimum Even Wall Line Width.

travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_enab.label: Compensate Wall Overlaps
travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_enab.description: Compensate the flow for parts of a wall being printed where there is already a wall in place.

travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_0_en.label: Compensate Outer Wall Overlaps
travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_0_en.description: Compensate the flow for parts of an outer wall being printed where there is already a wall in place.

travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_x_en.label: Compensate Inner Wall Overlaps
travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_x_en.description: Compensate the flow for parts of an inner wall being printed where there is already a wall in place.

wall_min_flow.label: Minimum Wall Flow
wall_min_flow.description: The minimum percentage flow rate allowed by the wall line. When a wall is close to an existing wall, wall overlap compensation can reduce its flow. Walls with a flow rate less than this value will be replaced by travel moves. When using this setting, you must enable wall overlap compensation and print the outer wall before printing the inner wall.

wall_min_flow_retract.label: Prefer Retract
wall_min_flow_retract.description: If enabled, retraction will be used rather than combing for travel moves that replace walls whose flow is below the minimum flow threshold.

fill_perimeter_gaps.label: Fill Gaps Between Walls
fill_perimeter_gaps.description: Fills the gaps between walls where no walls fit.

filter_out_tiny_gaps.label: Filter Out Tiny Gaps
filter_out_tiny_gaps.description: Filter out tiny gaps to reduce blobs on outside of model.

fill_outline_gaps.label: Print Thin Walls
fill_outline_gaps.description: Print pieces of the model which are horizontally thinner than the nozzle size.

min_feature_size.label: Minimum Feature Size
min_feature_size.description: Minimum thickness of thin features. Model features that are thinner than this value will not be printed, while features thicker than the Minimum Feature Size will be widened to the Minimum Wall Line Width.

min_bead_width.label: Minimum Thin Wall Line Width
min_bead_width.description: Width of the wall that will replace thin features (according to the Minimum Feature Size) of the model. If the Minimum Wall Line Width is thinner than the thickness of the feature, the wall will become as thick as the feature itself.

initial_layer_reserve.label: Initial Layer Reserve
initial_layer_reserve.description: The number of layers reserved for the bottom layer

xy_offset.label: Horizontal Expansion
xy_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in each layer. Positive values can compensate for too big holes; negative values can compensate for too small holes.

xy_offset_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Horizontal Expansion
xy_offset_layer_0.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in the first layer. A negative value can compensate for squishing of the first layer known as [elephant's foot].

layer_initial_deceleration_enable.label: layer initial deceleration
layer_initial_deceleration_enable.description: The start of each layer path is decelerated.

layer_deceleration_length.label: layer deceleration length
layer_deceleration_length.description: The starting segment of each layer path decelerates the length of the print.

layer_deceleration_speed.label: layer deceleration speed
layer_deceleration_speed.description: The start of each layer path slows down the printing speed.

z_seam_type.label: Z Seam Alignment
z_seam_type.description: The starting point of each path in a layer. When paths in consecutive layers start at the same point, a vertical seam may show on the print. When aligning these near a user specified location, the seam is easiest to remove. When placed randomly, the inaccuracies at the paths' start will be less noticeable. When taking the shortest path, the print will be quicker.

z_seam_position.label: Z Seam Position
z_seam_position.description: The position near where to start printing each part in a layer.

z_seam_x.label: Z Seam X
z_seam_x.description: The X coordinate of the position near where to start printing each part in a layer.
z_seam_x.value: (getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'frontleft' || getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'left' || getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'backleft') ? 0 : ((getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'front' || getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'back') ? eval(contex.value("machine_width")) / 2 : eval(contex.value("machine_width"))) - ((eval(contex.value("z_seam_relative")) || eval(contex.value("machine_center_is_zero"))) ? eval(contex.value("machine_width")) / 2 : 0)

z_seam_y.label: Z Seam Y
z_seam_y.description: The Y coordinate of the position near where to start printing each part in a layer.
z_seam_y.value: (getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'frontleft' || getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'front' || getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'frontright') ? 0 : ((getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'left' || getEnumValue("z_seam_position") == 'right') ? eval(contex.value("machine_depth")) / 2 : eval(contex.value("machine_depth"))) - ((eval(contex.value("z_seam_relative")) || eval(contex.value("machine_center_is_zero"))) ? eval(contex.value("machine_depth")) / 2 : 0)

z_seam_relative.label: Z Seam Relative
z_seam_relative.description: When enabled, the z seam coordinates are relative to each part's centre. When disabled, the coordinates define an absolute position on the build plate.

z_seam_min_angle_diff.label: Z Seam Min Angle Diff
z_seam_min_angle_diff.description: When the angle difference between the Sharpest Corner type point and the Shortest type point is less than this value, the Shortest type point is selected.

z_seam_max_angle.label: Z Seam Max Angle
z_seam_max_angle.description: Only corners smaller than this value are considered sharp corners. If there is no sharp corner point, select the Shortest type point.

z_seam_corner.label: Seam Corner Preference
z_seam_corner.description: Control whether corners on the model outline influence the position of the seam. None means that corners have no influence on the seam position. Hide Seam makes the seam more likely to occur on an inside corner. Expose Seam makes the seam more likely to occur on an outside corner. Hide or Expose Seam makes the seam more likely to occur at an inside or outside corner. Smart Hiding allows both inside and outside corners, if appropriate, they will appear more on the inner corners.

skin_no_small_gaps_heuristic.label: No Skin In Z Gaps
skin_no_small_gaps_heuristic.description: When there are only a few layers in the model with small vertical gaps, usually there should be a surface layer around the layers in a narrow space. If the vertical gap is very small, enable this setting to not generate a surface layer. This shortens the printing time and slicing time,but technically leaves infill exposed to the air.

skin_outline_count.label: Extra Skin Wall Count
skin_outline_count.description: Replace the outermost part of the top/bottom pattern with multiple concentric lines. Using one or two lines improves roofs that start on infill material.

ironing_enabled.label: Enable Ironing
ironing_enabled.description: Go over the top surface again, but this time extruding very little material. This is to further melt the plastic on the top, creating a smoother surface. The pressure in the nozzle chamber is kept high so that the creases on the surface are filled with material.

ironing_only_highest_layer.label: Iron Only Highest Layer
ironing_only_highest_layer.description: Only perform ironing on the very last layer of the mesh. This saves time if the lower layers don't need a smooth surface finish.

ironing_pattern.label: Ironing Pattern
ironing_pattern.description: The pattern to use for ironing top surfaces.

ironing_monotonic.label: Monotonic Ironing Order
ironing_monotonic.description: Print ironing lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.

ironing_line_spacing.label: Ironing Line Spacing
ironing_line_spacing.description: The distance between the lines of ironing.

ironing_flow.label: Ironing Flow
ironing_flow.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal skin line, to extrude during ironing. Keeping the nozzle filled helps filling some of the crevices of the top surface, but too much results in overextrusion and blips on the side of the surface.

ironing_inset.label: Ironing Inset
ironing_inset.description: A distance to keep from the edges of the model. Ironing all the way to the edge of the mesh may result in a jagged edge on your print.

speed_ironing.label: Ironing Speed
speed_ironing.description: The speed at which to pass over the top surface.

acceleration_ironing.label: Ironing Acceleration
acceleration_ironing.description: The acceleration with which ironing is performed.

jerk_ironing.label: Ironing Jerk
jerk_ironing.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change while performing ironing.

skin_overlap.label: Skin Overlap Percentage
skin_overlap.description: Adjust the amount of overlap between the walls and (the endpoints of) the skin-centerlines, as a percentage of the line widths of the skin lines and the innermost wall. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the skin. Note that, given an equal skin and wall line-width, any percentage over 50% may already cause any skin to go past the wall, because at that point the position of the nozzle of the skin-extruder may already reach past the middle of the wall.

skin_overlap_mm.label: Skin Overlap
skin_overlap_mm.description: Adjust the amount of overlap between the walls and (the endpoints of) the skin-centerlines. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the skin. Note that, given an equal skin and wall line-width, any value over half the width of the wall may already cause any skin to go past the wall, because at that point the position of the nozzle of the skin-extruder may already reach past the middle of the wall.

change_color.label: Change Print Color
change_color.description: Check this option to change the print material according to the specified mode.

change_color_mode.label: Change Color Mode
change_color_mode.description: You can specify which layer to change the printed material, or specify how many colors are in total, and finally automatically calculate which layer to change the material in.

first_change_color.label: First Change Color
first_change_color.description: The number of layers of the first exchange of printed materials.

second_change_color.label: Second Change Color
second_change_color.description: The number of layers of the Second exchange of printed materials.

third_change_color.label: Third Change Color
third_change_color.description: The number of layers of the Third exchange of printed materials.

infill_extruder_nr.label: Infill Extruder
infill_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing infill. This is used in multi-extrusion.

infill_sparse_density.label: Infill Density
infill_sparse_density.description: Adjusts the density of infill of the print.

infill_line_distance.label: Infill Line Distance
infill_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed infill lines. This setting is calculated by the infill density and the infill line width.

infill_pattern.label: Infill Pattern
infill_pattern.description: The pattern of the infill material of the print. The line and zig zag infill swap direction on alternate layers, reducing material cost. The grid, triangle, tri-hexagon, cubic, octet, quarter cubic, cross and concentric patterns are fully printed every layer. Gyroid, cubic, quarter cubic and octet infill change with every layer to provide a more equal distribution of strength over each direction.

zig_zaggify_infill.label: Connect Infill Lines
zig_zaggify_infill.description: Connect the ends where the infill pattern meets the inner wall using a line which follows the shape of the inner wall. Enabling this setting can make the infill adhere to the walls better and reduce the effects of infill on the quality of vertical surfaces. Disabling this setting reduces the amount of material used.
zig_zaggify_infill.enabled: getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'lines' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'grid' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'triangles' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'trihexagon' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'cubic' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'tetrahedral' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'quarter_cubic' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'cross' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'cross_3d' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'gyroid'

connect_infill_polygons.label: Connect Infill Polygons
connect_infill_polygons.description: Connect infill paths where they run next to each other. For infill patterns which consist of several closed polygons, enabling this setting greatly reduces the travel time.

infill_angles.label: Infill Line Directions
infill_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees for the lines and zig zag patterns and 45 degrees for all other patterns).

infill_offset_x.label: Infill X Offset
infill_offset_x.description: The infill pattern is moved this distance along the X axis.
infill_offset_x.enabled: getEnumValue("infill_pattern") != 'lightning' && getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'grid' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'lines' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'triangles' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'cubic' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'tetrahedral' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'quarter_cubic' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'zigzag'

infill_offset_y.label: Infill Y Offset
infill_offset_y.description: The infill pattern is moved this distance along the Y axis.
infill_offset_y.enabled: getEnumValue("infill_pattern") != 'lightning' && getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'grid' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'lines' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'triangles' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'cubic' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'tetrahedral' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'quarter_cubic' || getEnumValue("infill_pattern") == 'zigzag'

infill_randomize_start_location.label: Randomize Infill Start
infill_randomize_start_location.description: Randomize which infill line is printed first. This prevents one segment becoming the strongest, but it does so at the cost of an additional travel move.
infill_randomize_start_location.warning_value: True if infill_pattern not in ('grid', 'triangles', 'trihexagon', 'cubic', 'cubicsubdiv', 'tetrahedral', 'quarter_cubic') else None

infill_multiplier.label: Infill Line Multiplier
infill_multiplier.description: Convert each infill line to this multiple lines. The extra lines do not cross over each other, but avoid each other. This makes the infill stiffer, but increases print time and material usage.

infill_wall_line_count.label: Extra Infill Wall Count
infill_wall_line_count.description: Add extra walls around the infill area. Such walls can make top/bottom skin lines sag down less which means you need less top/bottom skin layers for the same quality at the cost of some extra material.This feature can combine with the Connect Infill Polygons to connect all the infill into a single extrusion path without the need for travels or retractions if configured right.

sub_div_rad_add.label: Cubic Subdivision Shell
sub_div_rad_add.description: An addition to the radius from the center of each cube to check for the boundary of the model, as to decide whether this cube should be subdivided. Larger values lead to a thicker shell of small cubes near the boundary of the model.

infill_overlap.label: Infill Overlap Percentage
infill_overlap.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

infill_overlap_mm.label: Infill Overlap
infill_overlap_mm.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

infill_wipe_dist.label: Infill Wipe Distance
infill_wipe_dist.description: Distance of a travel move inserted after every infill line, to make the infill stick to the walls better. This option is similar to infill overlap, but without extrusion and only on one end of the infill line.

infill_combination.label: Infill Layers Combination
infill_combination.description: Automatically combine several layers of sparse fill to print together, which can shorten the time. The inner and outer walls still maintain the original layer height printing.

infill_sparse_thickness.label: Infill Layer Thickness
infill_sparse_thickness.description: The thickness per layer of infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.

gradual_infill_steps.label: Gradual Infill Steps
gradual_infill_steps.description: Number of times to reduce the infill density by half when getting further below top surfaces. Areas which are closer to top surfaces get a higher density, up to the Infill Density.

gradual_infill_step_height.label: Gradual Infill Step Height
gradual_infill_step_height.description: The height of infill of a given density before switching to half the density.

infill_before_walls.label: Infill Before Walls
infill_before_walls.description: Print the infill before printing the walls. Printing the walls first may lead to more accurate walls, but overhangs print worse. Printing the infill first leads to sturdier walls, but the infill pattern might sometimes show through the surface.

min_infill_area.label: Minimum Infill Area
min_infill_area.description: Don't generate areas of infill smaller than this (use skin instead).

infill_support_enabled.label: Infill Support
infill_support_enabled.description: Print infill structures only where tops of the model should be supported. Enabling this reduces print time and material usage, but leads to ununiform object strength.

infill_support_angle.label: Infill Overhang Angle
infill_support_angle.description: The minimum angle of internal overhangs for which infill is added. At a value of 0° objects are totally filled with infill, 90° will not provide any infill.

skin_preshrink.label: Skin Removal Width
skin_preshrink.description: The largest width of skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing top/bottom skin at slanted surfaces in the model.

top_skin_preshrink.label: Top Skin Removal Width
top_skin_preshrink.description: The largest width of top skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing top skin at slanted surfaces in the model.

bottom_skin_preshrink.label: Bottom Skin Removal Width
bottom_skin_preshrink.description: The largest width of bottom skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing bottom skin at slanted surfaces in the model.

expand_skins_expand_distance.label: Skin Expand Distance
expand_skins_expand_distance.description: The distance the skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the walls on neighboring layers adhere better to the skin. Lower values save amount of material used.

top_skin_expand_distance.label: Top Skin Expand Distance
top_skin_expand_distance.description: The distance the top skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the walls on the layer above adhere better to the skin. Lower values save amount of material used.

bottom_skin_expand_distance.label: Bottom Skin Expand Distance
bottom_skin_expand_distance.description: The distance the bottom skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the skin adhere better to the walls on the layer below. Lower values save amount of material used.

max_skin_angle_for_expansion.label: Maximum Skin Angle for Expansion
max_skin_angle_for_expansion.description: Top and/or bottom surfaces of your object with an angle larger than this setting, won't have their top/bottom skin expanded. This avoids expanding the narrow skin areas that are created when the model surface has a near vertical slope. An angle of 0° is horizontal, while an angle of 90° is vertical.

min_skin_width_for_expansion.label: Minimum Skin Width for Expansion
min_skin_width_for_expansion.description: Skin areas narrower than this are not expanded. This avoids expanding the narrow skin areas that are created when the model surface has a slope close to the vertical.

skin_edge_support_thickness.label: Skin Edge Support Thickness
skin_edge_support_thickness.description: The thickness of the extra infill that supports skin edges.

skin_edge_support_layers.label: Skin Edge Support Layers
skin_edge_support_layers.description: The number of infill layers that supports skin edges.

lightning_infill_support_angle.label: Lightning Infill Support Angle
lightning_infill_support_angle.description: Determines when a lightning infill layer has to support anything above it. Measured in the angle given the thickness of a layer.

lightning_infill_overhang_angle.label: Lightning Infill Overhang Angle
lightning_infill_overhang_angle.description: Determines when a lightning infill layer has to support the model above it. Measured in the angle given the thickness.

lightning_infill_prune_angle.label: Lightning Infill Prune Angle
lightning_infill_prune_angle.description: The endpoints of infill lines are shortened to save on material. This setting is the angle of overhang of the endpoints of these lines.

lightning_infill_straightening_angle.label: Lightning Infill Straightening Angle
lightning_infill_straightening_angle.description: The infill lines are straightened out to save on printing time. This is the maximum angle of overhang allowed across the length of the infill line.

speed_slowtofast_slowdown.label: Sudden flow speed gradient
speed_slowtofast_slowdown.description: control the next path speed for sudden flow

speed_slowtofast_slowdown_revise_speed_f.label: Sudden flow boost speed factor
speed_slowtofast_slowdown_revise_speed_f.description: boost speed factor for sudden flow

default_material_print_temperature.label: Default Printing Temperature
default_material_print_temperature.description: The default temperature used for printing. This should be the [base] temperature of a material. All other print temperatures should use offsets based on this value

build_volume_temperature.label: Build Volume Temperature
build_volume_temperature.description: The temperature of the environment to print in. If this is 0, the build volume temperature will not be adjusted.

have_band.label: have band
have_band.description: The G12 model has a heating plate on the top

material_heater_band.label: Upper heating plate
material_heater_band.description: Used for heating plate at upper end of nozzle.

material_print_temperature_layer_0.label: Printing Temperature Initial Layer
material_print_temperature_layer_0.description: The temperature used for printing the first layer. Set at 0 to disable special handling of the initial layer.

material_initial_print_temperature.label: Initial Printing Temperature
material_initial_print_temperature.description: The minimal temperature while heating up to the Printing Temperature at which printing can already start.

material_final_print_temperature.label: Final Printing Temperature
material_final_print_temperature.description: The temperature to which to already start cooling down just before the end of printing.

material_extrusion_cool_down_speed.label: Extrusion Cool Down Speed Modifier
material_extrusion_cool_down_speed.description: The extra speed by which the nozzle cools while extruding. The same value is used to signify the heat up speed lost when heating up while extruding.

default_material_bed_temperature.label: Default Build Plate Temperature
default_material_bed_temperature.description: The default temperature used for the heated build plate. This should be the [base] temperature of a build plate. All other print temperatures should use offsets based on this value

material_bed_temperature.label: Build Plate Temperature
material_bed_temperature.description: The temperature used for the heated build plate. If this is 0, the bed temperature will not be adjusted.

material_bed_temperature_layer_0.label: Build Plate Temperature Initial Layer
material_bed_temperature_layer_0.description: The temperature used for the heated build plate at the first layer.

material_flow_dependent_temperature.label: Auto Temperature
material_flow_dependent_temperature.description: Change the temperature for each layer automatically with the average flow speed of that layer.

material_flow_temp_graph.label: Flow Temperature Graph
material_flow_temp_graph.description: Data linking material flow (in mm3 per second) to temperature (degrees Celsius).

material_shrinkage_percentage.label: Scaling Factor Shrinkage Compensation
material_shrinkage_percentage.description: To compensate for the shrinkage of the material as it cools down, the model will be scaled with this factor.

material_shrinkage_percentage_x.label: Horizontal Scaling Factor X Shrinkage Compensation
material_shrinkage_percentage_x.description: To compensate for the shrinkage of the material as it cools down, the model will be scaled with this factor in the X-direction (horizontally).

material_shrinkage_percentage_y.label: Horizontal Scaling Factor Y Shrinkage Compensation
material_shrinkage_percentage_y.description: To compensate for the shrinkage of the material as it cools down, the model will be scaled with this factor in the Y-direction (horizontally).

material_shrinkage_percentage_z.label: Vertical Scaling Factor Shrinkage Compensation
material_shrinkage_percentage_z.description: To compensate for the shrinkage of the material as it cools down, the model will be scaled with this factor in the Z-direction (vertically).

material_crystallinity.label: Crystalline Material
material_crystallinity.description: Is this material the type that breaks off cleanly when heated (crystalline), or is it the type that produces long intertwined polymer chains (non-crystalline)?

material_anti_ooze_retracted_position.label: Anti-ooze Retracted Position
material_anti_ooze_retracted_position.description: How far the material needs to be retracted before it stops oozing.

material_anti_ooze_retraction_speed.label: Anti-ooze Retraction Speed
material_anti_ooze_retraction_speed.description: How fast the material needs to be retracted during a filament switch to prevent oozing.

material_break_preparation_retracted_pos.label: Break Preparation Retracted Position
material_break_preparation_retracted_pos.description: How far the filament can be stretched before it breaks, while heated.

material_break_preparation_speed.label: Break Preparation Retraction Speed
material_break_preparation_speed.description: How fast the filament needs to be retracted just before breaking it off in a retraction.

material_break_preparation_temperature.label: Break Preparation Temperature
material_break_preparation_temperature.description: The temperature used to purge material, should be roughly equal to the highest possible printing temperature.

material_break_retracted_position.label: Break Retracted Position
material_break_retracted_position.description: How far to retract the filament in order to break it cleanly.

material_break_speed.label: Break Retraction Speed
material_break_speed.description: The speed at which to retract the filament in order to break it cleanly.

material_break_temperature.label: Break Temperature
material_break_temperature.description: The temperature at which the filament is broken for a clean break.

material_flow_ratio.label: Material Flow Ratio
material_flow_ratio.description: Volume differences may occur as the material is melted and then solidified. This setting changes all of the flow compensations proportionally.

material_flow.label: Flow
material_flow.description: Flow compensation: the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

wall_0_material_flow.label: Outer Wall Flow
wall_0_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on the outermost wall line.

wall_x_material_flow.label: Inner Wall(s) Flow
wall_x_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on wall lines for all wall lines except the outermost one.

roofing_material_flow.label: Top Surface Skin Flow
roofing_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on lines of the areas at the top of the print.

skirt_brim_material_flow.label: Skirt/Brim Flow
skirt_brim_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on skirt or brim lines.

support_material_flow.label: Support Flow
support_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on support structure lines.

support_interface_material_flow.label: Support Interface Flow
support_interface_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on lines of support roof or floor.

support_roof_material_flow.label: Support Roof Flow
support_roof_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on support roof lines.

support_bottom_material_flow.label: Support Floor Flow
support_bottom_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on support floor lines.

prime_tower_flow.label: Prime Tower Flow
prime_tower_flow.description: Flow compensation on prime tower lines.

material_flow_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Flow
material_flow_layer_0.description: Flow compensation for the first layer: the amount of material extruded on the initial layer is multiplied by this value.

wall_x_material_flow_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Inner Wall Flow
wall_x_material_flow_layer_0.description: Flow compensation on wall lines for all wall lines except the outermost one, but only for the first layer

wall_0_material_flow_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Outer Wall Flow
wall_0_material_flow_layer_0.description: Flow compensation on the outermost wall line of the first layer.

skin_material_flow_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Bottom Flow
skin_material_flow_layer_0.description: Flow compensation on bottom lines of the first layer

material_standby_temperature.label: Standby Temperature
material_standby_temperature.description: The temperature of the nozzle when another nozzle is currently used for printing.

material_max_volumetric_speed.label: Max volumetric speed
material_max_volumetric_speed.description: This setting is the volume of filament that can be melted andextruded per second. Printing speed is limited by max volumetric speed.

material_pressure_advance.label: Enable pressure advance
material_pressure_advance.description: Enable pressure advance,auto calibration result will be overwriten once enabled

speed_print.label: Print Speed
speed_print.description: The speed at which printing happens.

speed_infill.label: Infill Speed
speed_infill.description: The speed at which infill is printed.

speed_wall.label: Wall Speed
speed_wall.description: The speed at which the walls are printed.

speed_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Speed
speed_wall_0.description: The speed at which the outermost walls are printed. Printing the outer wall at a lower speed improves the final skin quality. However, having a large difference between the inner wall speed and the outer wall speed will affect quality in a negative way.

speed_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Speed
speed_wall_x.description: The speed at which all inner walls are printed. Printing the inner wall faster than the outer wall will reduce printing time. It works well to set this in between the outer wall speed and the infill speed.

speed_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Speed
speed_roofing.description: The speed at which top surface skin layers are printed.

speed_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Speed
speed_topbottom.description: The speed at which top/bottom layers are printed.

speed_support.label: Support Speed
speed_support.description: The speed at which the support structure is printed. Printing support at higher speeds can greatly reduce printing time. The surface quality of the support structure is not important since it is removed after printing.

speed_support_infill.label: Support Infill Speed
speed_support_infill.description: The speed at which the infill of support is printed. Printing the infill at lower speeds improves stability.

speed_support_interface.label: Support Interface Speed
speed_support_interface.description: The speed at which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.

speed_support_roof.label: Support Roof Speed
speed_support_roof.description: The speed at which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.

speed_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Speed
speed_support_bottom.description: The speed at which the floor of support is printed. Printing it at lower speed can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.

speed_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Speed
speed_prime_tower.description: The speed at which the prime tower is printed. Printing the prime tower slower can make it more stable when the adhesion between the different filaments is suboptimal.

speed_travel.label: Travel Speed
speed_travel.description: The speed at which travel moves are made.

speed_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Speed
speed_layer_0.description: The speed for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate.

speed_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Speed
speed_print_layer_0.description: The speed of printing for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate.

speed_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Speed
speed_travel_layer_0.description: The speed of travel moves in the initial layer. A lower value is advised to prevent pulling previously printed parts away from the build plate. The value of this setting can automatically be calculated from the ratio between the Travel Speed and the Print Speed.

skirt_brim_speed.label: Skirt/Brim Speed
skirt_brim_speed.description: The speed at which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done at the initial layer speed, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different speed.

speed_z_hop.label: Z Hop Speed
speed_z_hop.description: The speed at which the vertical Z movement is made for Z Hops. This is typically lower than the print speed since the build plate or machine's gantry is harder to move.

speed_slowdown_layers.label: Number of Slower Layers
speed_slowdown_layers.description: The first few layers are printed slower than the rest of the model, to get better adhesion to the build plate and improve the overall success rate of prints. The speed is gradually increased over these layers.

speed_equalize_flow_width_factor.label: Flow Equalization Ratio
speed_equalize_flow_width_factor.description: Extrusion width based correction factor on the speed. At 0% the movement speed is kept constant at the Print Speed. At 100% the movement speed is adjusted so that the flow (in mm³/s) is kept constant, i.e. lines half the normal Line Width are printed twice as fast and lines twice as wide are printed half as fast. A value larger than 100% can help to compensate for the higher pressure required to extrude wide lines.

speed_min_travel_speed_length.label: Min Path Length at Travel Speed
speed_min_travel_speed_length.description: When the length of the travel path between two print paths is less than this value, the travel path will run at the Print Speed.

set_wall_overhang_grading.label: Set Overhanging Wall Speed Grading
set_wall_overhang_grading.description: Whether To Set Graded Treatment Of Overhanging Wall Speed.

acceleration_enabled.label: Enable Acceleration Control
acceleration_enabled.description: Enables adjusting the print head acceleration. Increasing the accelerations can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.

acceleration_travel_enabled.label: Enable Travel Acceleration
acceleration_travel_enabled.description: Use a separate acceleration rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the acceleration value of the printed line at their destination.

acceleration_print.label: Print Acceleration
acceleration_print.description: The acceleration with which printing happens.

acceleration_infill.label: Infill Acceleration
acceleration_infill.description: The acceleration with which infill is printed.

acceleration_wall.label: Wall Acceleration
acceleration_wall.description: The acceleration with which the walls are printed.

acceleration_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Acceleration
acceleration_wall_0.description: The acceleration with which the outermost walls are printed.

acceleration_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Acceleration
acceleration_wall_x.description: The acceleration with which all inner walls are printed.

acceleration_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Acceleration
acceleration_roofing.description: The acceleration with which top surface skin layers are printed.

acceleration_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Acceleration
acceleration_topbottom.description: The acceleration with which top/bottom layers are printed.

acceleration_support.label: Support Acceleration
acceleration_support.description: The acceleration with which the support structure is printed.

acceleration_support_infill.label: Support Infill Acceleration
acceleration_support_infill.description: The acceleration with which the infill of support is printed.

acceleration_support_interface.label: Support Interface Acceleration
acceleration_support_interface.description: The acceleration with which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.

acceleration_support_roof.label: Support Roof Acceleration
acceleration_support_roof.description: The acceleration with which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.

acceleration_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Acceleration
acceleration_support_bottom.description: The acceleration with which the floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.

acceleration_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Acceleration
acceleration_prime_tower.description: The acceleration with which the prime tower is printed.

acceleration_travel.label: Travel Acceleration
acceleration_travel.description: The acceleration with which travel moves are made.

acceleration_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Acceleration
acceleration_layer_0.description: The acceleration for the initial layer.

acceleration_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Acceleration
acceleration_print_layer_0.description: The acceleration during the printing of the initial layer.

acceleration_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Acceleration
acceleration_travel_layer_0.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.

acceleration_skirt_brim.label: Skirt/Brim Acceleration
acceleration_skirt_brim.description: The acceleration with which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done with the initial layer acceleration, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different acceleration.

jerk_enabled.label: Enable Jerk Control
jerk_enabled.description: Enables adjusting the jerk of print head when the velocity in the X or Y axis changes. Increasing the jerk can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.

jerk_travel_enabled.label: Enable Travel Jerk
jerk_travel_enabled.description: Use a separate jerk rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the jerk value of the printed line at their destination.

jerk_print.label: Print Jerk
jerk_print.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change of the print head.

jerk_infill.label: Infill Jerk
jerk_infill.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which infill is printed.

jerk_wall.label: Wall Jerk
jerk_wall.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the walls are printed.

jerk_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Jerk
jerk_wall_0.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the outermost walls are printed.

jerk_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Jerk
jerk_wall_x.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which all inner walls are printed.

jerk_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Jerk
jerk_roofing.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top surface skin layers are printed.

jerk_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Jerk
jerk_topbottom.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top/bottom layers are printed.

jerk_support.label: Support Jerk
jerk_support.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the support structure is printed.

jerk_support_infill.label: Support Infill Jerk
jerk_support_infill.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the infill of support is printed.

jerk_support_interface.label: Support Interface Jerk
jerk_support_interface.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs and floors of support are printed.

jerk_support_roof.label: Support Roof Jerk
jerk_support_roof.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs of support are printed.

jerk_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Jerk
jerk_support_bottom.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the floors of support are printed.

jerk_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Jerk
jerk_prime_tower.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the prime tower is printed.

jerk_travel.label: Travel Jerk
jerk_travel.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which travel moves are made.

jerk_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Jerk
jerk_layer_0.description: The print maximum instantaneous velocity change for the initial layer.

jerk_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Jerk
jerk_print_layer_0.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change during the printing of the initial layer.

jerk_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Jerk
jerk_travel_layer_0.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.

jerk_skirt_brim.label: Skirt/Brim Jerk
jerk_skirt_brim.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the skirt and brim are printed.

speed_limit_to_height_enable.label: Print Speed Limit to Height Enable

line_width.label: Line Width
line_width.description: Width of a single line. Generally, the width of each line should correspond to the width of the nozzle. However, slightly reducing this value could produce better prints.

wall_line_width.label: Wall Line Width
wall_line_width.description: Width of a single wall line.

wall_line_width_0.label: Outer Wall Line Width
wall_line_width_0.description: Width of the outermost wall line. By lowering this value, higher levels of detail can be printed.

wall_line_width_x.label: Inner Wall(s) Line Width
wall_line_width_x.description: Width of a single wall line for all wall lines except the outermost one.

skin_line_width.label: Top/Bottom Line Width
skin_line_width.description: Width of a single top/bottom line.

roofing_line_width.label: Top Surface Skin Line Width
roofing_line_width.description: Width of a single line of the areas at the top of the print.

infill_line_width.label: Infill Line Width
infill_line_width.description: Width of a single infill line.

skirt_brim_line_width.label: Skirt/Brim Line Width
skirt_brim_line_width.description: Width of a single skirt or brim line.

support_line_width.label: Support Line Width
support_line_width.description: Width of a single support structure line.

support_interface_line_width.label: Support Interface Line Width
support_interface_line_width.description: Width of a single line of support roof or floor.

support_roof_line_width.label: Support Roof Line Width
support_roof_line_width.description: Width of a single support roof line.

support_bottom_line_width.label: Support Floor Line Width
support_bottom_line_width.description: Width of a single support floor line.

prime_tower_line_width.label: Prime Tower Line Width
prime_tower_line_width.description: Width of a single prime tower line.

initial_layer_line_width_factor.label: Initial Layer Line Width
initial_layer_line_width_factor.description: Multiplier of the line width on the first layer. Increasing this could improve bed adhesion.

initial_layer_line_width.label: Initial Layer Line Width
initial_layer_line_width.description: The line width on the first layer. Increasing this could improve bed adhesion.

retraction_enable.label: Enable Retraction
retraction_enable.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving over a non-printed area.

wall_0_wipe_dist.label: Wipe length
wall_0_wipe_dist.description: Wipe the length of the nozzle when retraction.

retract_at_layer_change.label: Retract at Layer Change
retract_at_layer_change.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving to the next layer.

retraction_amount.label: Retraction Distance
retraction_amount.description: The length of material retracted during a retraction move.

retraction_speed.label: Retraction Speed
retraction_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted and primed during a retraction move.

retraction_retract_speed.label: Retraction Retract Speed
retraction_retract_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted during a retraction move.

retraction_prime_speed.label: Retraction Prime Speed
retraction_prime_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is primed during a retraction move.

retraction_extra_prime_amount.label: Retraction Extra Prime Amount
retraction_extra_prime_amount.description: Some material can ooze away during a travel move, which can be compensated for here.

retraction_min_travel.label: Retraction Minimum Travel
retraction_min_travel.description: The minimum distance of travel needed for a retraction to happen at all. This helps to get fewer retractions in a small area.

retraction_count_max.label: Maximum Retraction Count
retraction_count_max.description: This setting limits the number of retractions occurring within the minimum extrusion distance window. Further retractions within this window will be ignored. This avoids retracting repeatedly on the same piece of filament, as that can flatten the filament and cause grinding issues.

retraction_extrusion_window.label: Minimum Extrusion Distance Window
retraction_extrusion_window.description: The window in which the maximum retraction count is enforced. This value should be approximately the same as the retraction distance, so that the number of times a retraction passes the same patch of material can be effectively limited.

limit_support_retractions.label: Limit Support Retractions
limit_support_retractions.description: Omit retraction when moving from support to support in a straight line. Enabling this setting saves print time, but can lead to excessive stringing within the support structure.

retraction_combing.label: Combing Mode
